# Project plan

## Start-up phase (Weeks 1–2)
- **Repo & collaboration:** Public GitHub repo (issues, milestones, labels), CODE_OF_CONDUCT, CONTRIBUTING, issue templates.
- **Licensing:** Code under **MIT**; documentation under **CC BY 4.0**.
- **Baseline CI:** GitHub Actions (R CMD check, unit tests), `renv` lockfile, small **EGMS fixture**.
- **Project scaffolding:** `{insar}` package skeleton; ArcGIS Pro toolbox/add-in stub; Quarto docs site.
- **Roadmap & reporting:** Milestones (M1/M2/M3), monthly status notes, CHANGELOG.

## Technical delivery (Months 1–6)
- **Month 1–2 (v0.1 / MVP):**  
  EGMS readers + validators; minimal **Import → time-enabled layer** tool; per-point time-series plot; `{insar}`: `egms_read_*()`, `ts_plot_point()`, simple QC; Quickstart tutorial.
- **Month 3–4 (v0.3):**  
  Group plots (AOI/selection); plot export (PNG/SVG); trend methods (robust/loess); symbology presets; optional time-enabled publish helpers; Tutorial #1.
- **Month 5–6 (v1.0):**  
  Interpolation (IDW/kriging) for screening surfaces; performance pass; Tutorial #2; API reference; v1.0 tagged release + short demo video.

## Other aspects
- **Openness:** MIT (code) + CC BY 4.0 (docs); issues/milestones public; small EGMS sample data included.
- **Hosting & contribs:** GitHub for code, discussions, and releases; “good first issue” labels.
- **Comments:**  
  - Kickoff post (Month 1) on project site + LinkedIn.  
  - Progress note (Month 3) with v0.3.  
  - Release post (Month 6) with v1.0, tutorials, and demo.  
  - Offer a short write-up for the R Consortium blog at release.

## Budget & funding plan (USD 20,000 total)
- **Milestone 1 — v0.1 (end Month 2): $7,000**  
  EGMS I/O + validators; minimal toolbox; per-point plot; Quickstart; CI running.
- **Milestone 2 — v0.3 (end Month 4): $8,000**  
  Group plots; exports; trend methods; symbology; optional publish helpers; Tutorial #1.
- **Milestone 3 — v1.0 (end Month 6): $5,000**  
  Interpolation; performance pass; Tutorial #2; API reference; tagged release + demo.

> Primary cost category: labor (development, docs, testing). No indirects; cloud costs only if required for hosting small EGMS fixtures.
